page.title: 12 PRESTATYN HIGH SCHOOL
page.content: Prestatyn High School is a co-educational comprehensive school for pupils of 11-18 years.The school is the largest in Clwyd,there being nearly 1500 children there at present,drawn mainly from the Prestatyn & Dyserth area.The number of pupils from outside the traditional catchment area is increasing now there is more parental choice.The teaching staff is 85.The school is divided into eight basic units called Houses & these are the basis for the school's organisation.The usual subjects are taught in the first two years of school,then a choice of subjects is made in the third year & again in the fourth year geared towards public examinations.Pupils may return to study A-level subjects in the Sixth Form.
